canonical_explanation.text: A house is a place where we live with our family. We need a house to protect us from the sun, rain, cold, wind, insects, and wild animals. There are different types of houses. A pucca house is made of bricks, cement, and concrete and is very strong. A kutcha house is made of mud, straw, and bamboo. Flats are houses built one on top of another in big buildings. Huts are small houses made of mud and straw found in villages. Bungalows are big houses with gardens. Tents are temporary houses made of cloth. Houseboats float on water. Houses are made from many materials like bricks, cement, wood, mud, straw, bamboo, and stones. Inside a house, there are different rooms: the bedroom is for sleeping, the kitchen is for cooking, the bathroom is for bathing, the living room is for sitting with family, and the dining room is for eating food. We have furniture like beds, chairs, tables, cupboards, and sofas in our homes.
rules: We need a house for protection from heat, rain, cold, wind, insects, and animals.
Pucca houses are made of bricks and cement. They are strong.
Kutcha houses are made of mud, straw, and bamboo.
Flats are in buildings, huts are in villages, tents are temporary.
Houses are made from bricks, cement, wood, mud, straw, bamboo, and stones.
Rooms: bedroom (sleep), kitchen (cook), bathroom (bathe), living room (sit), dining room (eat).

questions.question_text: Why do we need a house?

options.text: To protect us from sun, rain, and cold

questions.explanation_correct: We need a house to protect us from the hot sun, rain, cold weather, wind, insects, and wild animals. A house keeps us safe and comfortable.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not need a house to fly, swim, or drive. We need a house for protection from bad weather and to stay safe.

questions.question_text: A house made of bricks and cement is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A house made of bricks and cement is called a pucca house. Pucca houses are strong and last for a long time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Kutcha houses are made of mud and straw. Tents are made of cloth. Huts are made of mud. Pucca houses are made of bricks and cement.

questions.question_text: Which of these is used to build houses?
questions.explanation_correct: Bricks are used to build houses. Bricks are hard blocks that are stacked together with cement to make strong walls.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not build houses with chocolate, toys, or flowers. Bricks are one of the most common materials used to build houses.

questions.question_text: Which room do we use for sleeping?
questions.explanation_correct: We sleep in the bedroom. The bedroom has a bed, pillows, and blankets for comfortable sleeping.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The kitchen is for cooking. The bathroom is for bathing. The garden is outside. We sleep in the bedroom.

questions.question_text: A house protects us from:
questions.explanation_correct: A house protects us from rain, the hot sun, cold weather, wind, and insects. It is our safe place.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Houses do not protect us from homework, playing, or singing. They protect us from bad weather and keep us safe.

questions.question_text: A house made of mud and straw is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A house made of mud and straw is called a kutcha house. These houses are found in many villages in India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pucca houses are made of bricks. Flats are in buildings. Bungalows are big and strong. Kutcha houses are made of mud and straw.

questions.question_text: Which material is used to make a hut?
questions.explanation_correct: Huts are made of mud and straw. Sometimes bamboo is also used. These materials are easy to find in villages.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Huts are not made of glass, gold, or paper. They are simple houses made of mud, straw, and bamboo.

questions.question_text: In which room does mother cook food?
questions.explanation_correct: Food is cooked in the kitchen. The kitchen has a stove, pots, pans, and all the things needed for cooking.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bedrooms are for sleeping. Bathrooms are for bathing. Living rooms are for sitting. Food is cooked in the kitchen.

questions.question_text: Houses built one on top of another in a building are called:
questions.explanation_correct: Flats are houses built one on top of another in a big building. Many families live in one building, each in their own flat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Huts are in villages. Tents are temporary. Bungalows are big single houses. Flats are in tall buildings.

questions.question_text: We sit on a ___ in the living room.
questions.explanation_correct: We sit on a sofa in the living room. Sofas are soft and comfortable furniture where the family sits together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A stove is in the kitchen. A bathtub is in the bathroom. We sit on sofas and chairs in the living room.

questions.question_text: A tent is made of:
questions.explanation_correct: A tent is made of cloth or canvas. Tents are temporary shelters that can be put up and taken down easily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tents are not made of bricks, gold, or glass. They are made of cloth or canvas stretched over poles.

questions.question_text: In which room do we take a bath?
questions.explanation_correct: We take a bath in the bathroom. The bathroom has a tap, bucket, and soap for bathing and cleaning ourselves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The kitchen is for cooking. The living room is for sitting. The bedroom is for sleeping. We bathe in the bathroom.

questions.question_text: A big house with a garden around it is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A bungalow is a big house with a garden around it. Bungalows have many rooms and are usually for one family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Huts are small and simple. Tents are temporary. Flats are in buildings. A big house with a garden is called a bungalow.

questions.question_text: Wood is used to make:
questions.explanation_correct: Wood is used to make doors, windows, and furniture like chairs, tables, and cupboards in our houses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wood cannot make water, air, or clouds. It is used to make parts of houses like doors and furniture like chairs and tables.

questions.question_text: Where does the family eat food together?
questions.explanation_correct: The family eats food together in the dining room. The dining room has a dining table and chairs where everyone sits to eat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The bathroom is for bathing. The bedroom is for sleeping. The garage is for cars. We eat in the dining room.

questions.question_text: During winter, a house keeps us safe from:
questions.explanation_correct: During winter, our house keeps us safe from the cold wind. The walls and roof stop the cold air from coming inside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Houses protect us from cold weather, not from homework or friends. In winter, our warm house keeps us comfortable.

questions.question_text: A house that floats on water is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A houseboat is a house that floats on water. In Kashmir and Kerala, many people live in houseboats on lakes and rivers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Flats are in buildings. An igloo is made of ice. A bungalow is on land. A house on water is called a houseboat.

questions.question_text: Cement is used to join ___ together while building a house.
questions.explanation_correct: Cement is used to join bricks together when building a house. It is like a strong glue that holds the bricks in place.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cement is not for toys, flowers, or books. It is a building material that sticks bricks together to make strong walls.

questions.question_text: We keep our clothes in a:
questions.explanation_correct: We keep our clothes in a cupboard. A cupboard has shelves and doors to store clothes neatly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A stove is for cooking. A bathtub is for bathing. A sink is for washing. We keep our clothes in a cupboard.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a type of house?
questions.explanation_correct: A school is not a type of house. A school is a place where children go to learn. Huts, flats, and bungalows are types of houses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Huts, flats, and bungalows are all types of houses where people live. A school is a building for learning, not for living.

questions.question_text: It is raining very heavily. Where should you go?
questions.explanation_correct: When it rains heavily, you should go inside the house. The house protects you from getting wet and keeps you safe from lightning.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Playing in heavy rain, climbing trees, or standing in open fields can be dangerous. Your house is the safest place during heavy rain.

questions.question_text: In a village, Ramu's house is made of mud and bamboo. What type of house does Ramu have?
questions.explanation_correct: Ramu has a kutcha house because it is made of mud and bamboo. Kutcha houses are common in Indian villages.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pucca houses are made of bricks and cement. Flats are in buildings. Bungalows are big. A house of mud and bamboo is a kutcha house.

questions.question_text: Anita lives in a tall building on the 5th floor. She lives in a:
questions.explanation_correct: Anita lives in a flat. Flats are houses in tall buildings where many families live on different floors.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Huts are in villages. Tents are temporary. Houseboats are on water. A house in a tall building is called a flat.

questions.question_text: Why is a pucca house stronger than a kutcha house?

options.text: Because it is made of bricks and cement which are strong

questions.explanation_correct: A pucca house is stronger because it is made of bricks and cement, which are hard and strong materials. Mud and straw are weaker.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Paint, size, and windows do not make a house strong. The materials used (bricks and cement vs mud and straw) decide how strong a house is.

questions.question_text: Amma is making dal in the kitchen. She is in which room of the house?
questions.explanation_correct: Amma is in the kitchen. The kitchen is the room where we cook food like dal, rice, roti, and vegetables.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bedrooms are for sleeping. Bathrooms are for bathing. Living rooms are for sitting. Cooking happens in the kitchen.

questions.question_text: People in cold places like Ladakh build houses with thick stone walls. Why?

options.text: To keep the cold wind out and warmth inside

questions.explanation_correct: Thick stone walls help keep the cold wind outside and the warmth inside the house. This keeps people warm in very cold weather.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Looking nice or being heavy is not the reason. Thick stone walls protect people from extreme cold by trapping warmth inside.

questions.question_text: A circus uses tents as temporary shelters. Why are tents temporary?

options.text: Because they are made of brick
Because they can be easily put up and taken down

questions.explanation_correct: Tents are temporary because they can be easily put up and taken down. They are made of cloth and poles that are light and easy to move.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tents are not made of brick, not heavy, and not underground. They are light cloth shelters that can be set up and removed quickly.

questions.question_text: In Kerala, some people live on houseboats. Where are these houseboats?
questions.explanation_correct: Houseboats float on water. In Kerala, people live on houseboats on lakes and backwaters. These are special houses on water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Houseboats are not on mountains, in the sky, or under the ground. They are on water, floating on rivers and lakes.

questions.question_text: Bamboo is used to build houses in some villages. Bamboo is a:
questions.explanation_correct: Bamboo is a type of tall, strong plant. Its long, hard stems are used to build houses, especially in villages in India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bamboo is not metal, plastic, or rock. It is a tall plant that grows very fast and is strong enough to build houses.

questions.question_text: We sleep on a bed in the bedroom. A bed is a type of:
questions.explanation_correct: A bed is a type of furniture. Furniture includes things like beds, chairs, tables, cupboards, and sofas that we use in our house.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bed is not food, an animal, or a vehicle. It is a piece of furniture that we use for sleeping in the bedroom.

questions.question_text: Why do houses have a roof?

options.text: To protect us from rain and sun

questions.explanation_correct: Houses have a roof to protect us from rain, hot sun, and cold weather. The roof is like an umbrella over the whole house.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The roof is not just for looks or storing toys. Its main job is to protect people inside from rain, sun, and extreme weather.

questions.question_text: Which room in the house has a stove and pots?
questions.explanation_correct: The kitchen has a stove and pots. These are used for cooking food. The kitchen also has plates, spoons, and other cooking items.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Stoves and pots are not kept in bedrooms, bathrooms, or living rooms. They are in the kitchen where food is cooked.

questions.question_text: Match: Bricks and cement are used to build ___ houses.
questions.explanation_correct: Bricks and cement are used to build pucca houses. Pucca houses are very strong and can last for many years.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Kutcha houses use mud and straw. Tents use cloth. Bricks and cement make pucca houses, which are the strongest type.

questions.question_text: Ravi lives in a city in a tall building. Gopi lives in a village in a mud house. What type of houses do they have?
questions.explanation_correct: Ravi lives in a flat in a tall building in the city. Gopi lives in a kutcha house made of mud in the village.
questions.explanation_incorrect: City tall buildings have flats, not huts or tents. Village mud houses are kutcha houses, not bungalows or flats.

questions.question_text: Name two materials used to build a pucca house.
questions.explanation_correct: Bricks and cement are two important materials used to build a pucca house. They make the house strong and long-lasting.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Mud and straw make kutcha houses. Paper and cloth are too weak. Bricks and cement are the correct materials for pucca houses.

questions.question_text: Why do different places in India have different types of houses?

options.text: Because the weather and materials available are different
Because everyone builds the same house

questions.explanation_correct: Different places have different weather and materials. In hot places, houses have open spaces. In cold places, houses have thick walls. People use the materials they can find nearby.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Colours do not decide house types. The weather (hot, cold, rainy) and available materials (mud, stone, bamboo, bricks) decide what type of house people build.

questions.question_text: Name the rooms: We cook in the ___, sleep in the ___, and bathe in the ___.
questions.explanation_correct: We cook in the kitchen, sleep in the bedroom, and bathe in the bathroom. Each room has a special use.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Kitchen is for cooking. Bedroom is for sleeping. Bathroom is for bathing. The order is kitchen, bedroom, bathroom.

questions.question_text: If it is very hot outside and very cold at night, how does a house help?

options.text: It keeps us cool in heat and warm in cold

questions.explanation_correct: A house keeps us cool when it is hot and warm when it is cold. The walls and roof protect us from extreme temperatures.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A house does not change the weather, make food, or take us to school. It provides shelter and protects us from hot and cold weather.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a material used to build houses?
questions.explanation_correct: Ice cream is not a building material! We eat ice cream. Bricks, wood, and cement are real materials used to build houses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bricks, wood, and cement are all used to build houses. Ice cream is food, not a building material.

questions.question_text: We need a house for protection.
questions.explanation_correct: We need a house to protect us from rain, sun, cold, wind, insects, and wild animals. A house is our safe shelter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Houses protect us from bad weather and keep us safe. Everyone needs a place to live.

questions.question_text: A pucca house is made of mud and straw.
questions.explanation_correct: A pucca house is NOT made of mud and straw. It is made of bricks and cement. A kutcha house is made of mud and straw.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pucca houses are made of strong materials like bricks and cement. Mud and straw are used for kutcha houses.

questions.question_text: We cook food in the kitchen.
questions.explanation_correct: We cook food in the kitchen. The kitchen has a stove, pots, pans, and everything needed to make tasty meals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. The kitchen is the room in our house where food is cooked.

questions.question_text: Bricks are used to build houses.
questions.explanation_correct: Bricks are used to build the walls of pucca houses. They are strong, hard blocks that are joined with cement.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Bricks are one of the most important materials for building strong houses.

questions.question_text: A tent is a permanent house.
questions.explanation_correct: A tent is NOT a permanent house. It is a temporary shelter made of cloth that can be put up and taken down easily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tents are temporary, not permanent. They are made of cloth and can be moved from place to place.

questions.question_text: The bedroom is used for cooking.
questions.explanation_correct: The bedroom is NOT used for cooking. It is used for sleeping. Cooking is done in the kitchen.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bedrooms are for sleeping and resting. Cooking is done in the kitchen, which has a stove and cooking items.

questions.question_text: Houses protect us from insects and wild animals.
questions.explanation_correct: Houses protect us from insects like mosquitoes and from wild animals. Walls, doors, and windows keep them outside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Houses have walls, doors, and windows that keep insects and animals from coming inside.

questions.question_text: Houseboats are found in Kerala.
questions.explanation_correct: Houseboats are found in Kerala and also in Kashmir. In Kerala, people live on houseboats on the beautiful backwaters.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Kerala is famous for its houseboats on the backwaters. People live and travel on these floating houses.

questions.question_text: All houses in India are made of bricks and cement.
questions.explanation_correct: Not all houses in India are made of bricks and cement. Many houses in villages are made of mud, straw, bamboo, and stone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: India has many types of houses. Village homes may use mud, straw, and bamboo. City homes often use bricks and cement.

questions.question_text: A sofa and a chair are types of furniture.
questions.explanation_correct: A sofa and a chair are both types of furniture. Furniture includes things like sofas, chairs, tables, beds, and cupboards that we use in our homes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Sofas and chairs are furniture we use for sitting in our homes.

questions.question_text: A kutcha house is stronger than a pucca house.
questions.explanation_correct: A kutcha house is NOT stronger than a pucca house. Pucca houses made of bricks and cement are much stronger than kutcha houses made of mud and straw.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pucca houses are stronger because bricks and cement are harder than mud and straw. Kutcha houses can be damaged easily by heavy rain.
